results.title: The Gambler Dostoevsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Risk”.
A play based on Dostoevsky’s novel “The Gambler”. Dostoevsky lived his life on the edge of disaster, financial, political and emotional, and the story is about his gambling and about his loving. Dostoevsky’s widow, Anna, recalls her relationship with this complicated man.

results.title: A New Deal?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
About 10000 people around the world die every day from lack of food. Are we really heading for global disaster? What can the world do to help itself? This and other questions about world poverty are discussed

results.title: Business as Usual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program examines business ties between the wealthy North and destitute South. Brazil and Tanzania are featured in this episode

results.title: The Bottom Rung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program reports from Bangladesh, Tanzania and Brazil and highlights the extreme poverty there. It poses the question ‘Can the gap between rich world and poor world ever be closed?’

results.title: Say English cheese
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Cheese making today is an industry, but still a craft. And English cheeses are now better value than ever, in price and nutritional value. From the series “Review No 10 - 27th year (635)”.

results.title: Full cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
With the present shortage of fuel in Britain, the bicycle has come into its own as a humane machine, efficient, and adaptable alike for work or pleasure. This general film on cycling shows the manufacture of bicycles, bicycle competitions, riding and safety.

results.title: Eat to live
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Food has alway’s been man’s first preoccupation. Today, while many people get too little of the foods necessary for good health, others of us are overweight through eating too much food that has little or no nutritional value
